text: Masao Kato (加藤 正夫, Katō Masao, March 15, 1947 – December 30, 2004), also known as Kato Kensei (加藤剱正 Katō Kensei), was a Japanese professional go player at Nihon Ki-in and former president of the International Go Federation. He won 46 titles,The total number of titles that he won is behind Eio Sakata including the Oza (王座, King) eight times in a row. He also became the 2nd player to reach 1,200 career wins. ==Notable titles== Domestic Domestic Domestic Title Wins Runners-up Kisei (棋聖, Board Master) Challenged 4 times to the defending champion (1978, 1988, 1991, 1993) Meijin (名人, Grand Master, hosted by Asahi Shinbun) 2 (1986, 1987) 2 (1981, 1988) Honinbo (本因坊) 4 (1977–1979, 2002) 5 (1969, 1980, 1995, 1997, 2003) Tengen (天元, Center) 4 (1978–1981) 2 (1982, 1991) OzaKato holds the honorary Oza title 11 (1979, 1980, 1982–1989, 1993) 3 (1981, 1990, 1994) Judan (10-dan) 7 (1976–1979, 1983, 1987, 1997) 4 (1980, 1984, 1988, 1998) Gosei (碁聖, Master of Go) 3 (1976, 1977, 1987) 4 (1978, 1981, 1984, 1988) Agon CupThis tournament allows top amateur players to participate. (阿含杯) 3 (1995, 1996, 2003) 1 (1997) Ryusei (竜星, dragon star) 2 (1998, 2001) NHK Cup 1 (1988) 3 (1974, 1993, 1994) NEC Cup 3 (1990, 1991, 1996) 3 (1992, 1999, 2000) Continental Continental Continental China-Japan Agon CupThis is an exhibition match between the Japanese Agon Cup champion and the mainland Chinese Agon Cup champion 1 (2003) ==Books== *Kato's Attack and Kill *The Chinese Opening ==References== ==Other websites== *Kato Masao at gobase.org - lists some of his victories and over a thousand-game records. title: Masao Kato
